{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":2987641,"name":"Matthew Lee","username":"Matth3w_Lee","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/m/ba9def/{size}.png","created_at":"2022-01-09T23:08:36.182Z","cooked":"

For the monkey bar challenge, are the rungs magnetic? Could I possibly use an electromagnet to pull up my robot?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2022-01-09T23:08:36.182Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":34,"reads":791,"readers_count":790,"score":373.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":399349,"topic_slug":"them-monkey-bars","display_username":"Matthew Lee","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/use-of-door-magnets-for-climbing/400491/6","internal":true,"reflection":true,"title":"Use of door magnets for climbing","clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":50281,"hidden":false,"trust_level":0,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/them-monkey-bars/399349/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":2987647,"name":"Bri","username":"BriFRC","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/brifrc/{size}/131024_2.png","created_at":"2022-01-09T23:11:02.214Z","cooked":"

They are made of steal, but an electromagnet if powered would shut off at the end of the match when the robot is disabled, which would be unideal. I don‚Äôt necessarily see a specific rule against it though. If someone else see‚Äôs one feel free to add on.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2022-01-09T23:11:02.214Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":783,"readers_count":782,"score":246.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":399349,"topic_slug":"them-monkey-bars","display_username":"Bri","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":6}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":31589,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Dream Big"},"post_url":"/t/them-monkey-bars/399349/2","custom_user_title":"Dream Big","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":6}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":6,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2987649,"name":"Jim Forbes","username":"MrForbes","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mrforbes/{size}/165505_2.png","created_at":"2022-01-09T23:13:39.020Z","cooked":"

Do the math to figure out how much power it would take to hold that much weight‚Ä¶and don‚Äôt be surprised if the battery is not up to the task.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2022-01-09T23:13:39.020Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":771,"readers_count":770,"score":504.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":399349,"topic_slug":"them-monkey-bars","display_username":"Jim Forbes","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":26}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":6260,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Jim Forbes 1726 Mechanical Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/them-monkey-bars/399349/3","custom_user_title":"Jim Forbes 1726 Mechanical Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":23},{"id":"+1","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":26,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2987651,"name":"Kaia","username":"Karaoke","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/karaoke/{size}/170833_2.png","created_at":"2022-01-09T23:14:43.595Z","cooked":"

Unless it was just used as an aid to get you closer to the bar somehow?

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2022-01-09T23:14:43.595Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":745,"readers_count":744,"score":184.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":399349,"topic_slug":"them-monkey-bars","display_username":"Kaia","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":42257,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"4272 Mentor, Purdue Ri3D, PFP"},"post_url":"/t/them-monkey-bars/399349/4","custom_user_title":"4272 Mentor, Purdue Ri3D, PFP","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2987674,"name":"RedLeader342","username":"RedLeader342","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/redleader342/{size}/174347_2.png","created_at":"2022-01-09T23:34:01.162Z","cooked":"

i could see that. maybe for alignment of a claw latch. alignment for traversing will be difficult with the swinging

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2022-01-09T23:34:01.162Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":684,"readers_count":683,"score":181.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":399349,"topic_slug":"them-monkey-bars","display_username":"RedLeader342","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":42257,"username":"Karaoke","name":"Kaia","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/karaoke/{size}/170833_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":14252,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Its BURNIE. not Bernie. And certainly not Burn-E."},"post_url":"/t/them-monkey-bars/399349/5","custom_user_title":"Its BURNIE. not Bernie. And certainly not Burn-E.","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2987680,"name":"Kaia","username":"Karaoke","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/karaoke/{size}/170833_2.png","created_at":"2022-01-09T23:43:11.366Z","cooked":"

Yeah and it could perhaps account for any difference in angle. I don‚Äôt know that much about electromagnets but I suppose if you‚Äôre clever about it then it could be the difference between needing to actuate an arm or not.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2022-01-09T23:43:11.366Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":5,"reads":636,"readers_count":635,"score":172.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":399349,"topic_slug":"them-monkey-bars","display_username":"Kaia","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":14252,"username":"RedLeader342","name":"RedLeader342","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/redleader342/{size}/174347_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":42257,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"4272 Mentor, Purdue Ri3D, PFP"},"post_url":"/t/them-monkey-bars/399349/6","custom_user_title":"4272 Mentor, Purdue Ri3D, PFP","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2987693,"name":"philso","username":"philso","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/p/e68b1a/{size}.png","created_at":"2022-01-09T23:55:33.005Z","cooked":"

It takes a lot of current and a lot of turns (a lot of HEAVY copper) to get any significant force. The force also drops of very rapidly with distance (1/distance^3) so it will likely be difficult to make an effective mechanism using an electromagnet. The logistics of controlling a large heavy object on the end of a long arm is also not going to be easy.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2022-01-09T23:55:33.005Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":578,"readers_count":577,"score":190.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":399349,"topic_slug":"them-monkey-bars","display_username":"philso","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":42257,"username":"Karaoke","name":"Kaia","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/karaoke/{size}/170833_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":4}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":15467,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/them-monkey-bars/399349/7","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":4}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":4,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2988040,"name":"Gus Michel II","username":"GeeTwo","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/geetwo/{size}/120962_2.png","created_at":"2022-01-10T06:17:18.882Z","cooked":"

If you‚Äôre just trying to dampen swing, a bit of rubber or similar material in the right place will be more effective (especially in terms of weight) than an an electromagnet.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2022-01-10T06:17:18.882Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":467,"readers_count":466,"score":118.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":399349,"topic_slug":"them-monkey-bars","display_username":"Gus Michel II","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":22335,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Somebody Else ‚¨õüü´üü•üüßüü®üü©üü¶üü™‚ñí‚ñí‚¨ú "},"post_url":"/t/them-monkey-bars/399349/8","custom_user_title":"Somebody Else ‚¨õüü´üü•üüßüü®üü©üü¶üü™‚ñí‚ñí‚¨ú ","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2988156,"name":"Aidan","username":"aidanm","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/aidanm/{size}/198097_2.png","created_at":"2022-01-10T15:18:41.654Z","cooked":"

Sorry to revive a likely-futile thought exercise, but switchable permanent magnets like this could be actuated easily and may be a better consideration than electromagnets. They still allow you to control the presence of an external magnetic field, but without the heavy power drain of electromagnets, and won‚Äôt switch off at the end of the match.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2022-01-10T15:18:41.654Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":390,"readers_count":389,"score":98.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":399349,"topic_slug":"them-monkey-bars","display_username":"Aidan","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.amazon.com/Magswitch-8100238-MagSquare-400/dp/B007Q6YPV6?ref_=ast_sto_dp","internal":false,"reflection":false,"clicks":50}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":47310,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Rockets & Robots"},"post_url":"/t/them-monkey-bars/399349/9","custom_user_title":"Rockets & Robots","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2988233,"name":"Nelson Green (1108 Mentor Coach Electrical Programming)","username":"ngreen","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ngreen/{size}/264478_2.png","created_at":"2022-01-10T16:56:16.152Z","cooked":"

I think in 2018 or 2019 they outlawed electromagnets through the Q&A. We had one on the 2016 and 2014 robot for the pneumatapult. They do typically allow a solenoid less than 10W, and you could consider it a zero length solenoid. Without the Q&A answer, that is the legal reasoning we‚Äôd give. We used spike relays back then to turn on/off. I haven‚Äôt carefully read that part in this years manual yet.

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2022-01-10T16:56:16.152Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":349,"readers_count":348,"score":84.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":399349,"topic_slug":"them-monkey-bars","display_username":"Nelson Green (1108 Mentor Coach Electrical Programming)","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":2695,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/them-monkey-bars/399349/10","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2988486,"name":"Rod","username":"Weldingrod1","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/weldingrod1/{size}/162109_2.png","created_at":"2022-01-10T20:39:29.985Z","cooked":"

I‚Äôve used multi-thousand pound permanent magnetic lifters; super handy! There are some sorta small ones too. Many have a v-shaped area on the bottom to accommodate round stock. The rotate/engage force on mag lifters is non-trivial and goes up with size. The better the pole pieces fit the target, the stronger the holding power. The rating for round is MUCH less than flat. Th PNL0250 is 250 pounds on flat, 125 pounds on 2"+ diameter, 1/2" wall stock. You MUST let it self align; if its not in full contact you aren‚Äôt going to grip well at all. Using two magnets will require some springs to allow alignment and load sharing.
Electromagnets: Not as crazy as you might think, BUT will let go when power is off. A 13W magnet can get you in the 210 pound pull range. You would really want shaped poles to optimize your grip, and go ahead and wind it to match your power supply and capabilities. Looks a bit hefty

mcmaster.com

McMaster-Carr

McMaster-Carr is the complete source for your plant with over 595,000 products. 98% of products ordered ship from stock and deliver same or next day.

Safety wise: engaged ones REALLY want steel. Don‚Äôt get your fingers between them and their #1 love! Squishy‚Ä¶

magnetics.com

101Y-Catalog-07-Power-Lift.pdf

1371.33 KB

The DL0334 will be in the 100 to 167 pound range on those pipes. Needs testing. There‚Äôs a 3:1 safety factor designed in there too, which might be OK to use on a bot where you can live with a crash.

magnetics.com

101Y-Catalog-08-Versa-Dynamic-Lift.pdf

974.83 KB

of door magnets for climbing","clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":46443,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/them-monkey-bars/399349/11","custom_user_title":"Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2988512,"name":"Skye Leake","username":"Skyehawk","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/skyehawk/{size}/179363_2.png","created_at":"2022-01-10T20:59:37.264Z","cooked":"

Small magnets, permanent or otherwise, can be very useful alignment devices, especially on a wiggly arm to get a quick and positive engagement.

Emphasis on the phrase ‚Äúalignment device(s)‚Äù.

","post_number":12,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2022-01-10T20:59:37.264Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":227,"readers_count":226,"score":85.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":399349,"topic_slug":"them-monkey-bars","display_username":"Skye Leake","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":true,"admin":false,"staff":true,"user_id":19235,"hidden":false,"trust_level":4,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Pretengineer"},"post_url":"/t/them-monkey-bars/399349/12","custom_user_title":"Pretengineer","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2988851,"name":"philso","username":"philso","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/p/e68b1a/{size}.png","created_at":"2022-01-11T03:32:48.672Z","cooked":"

One would have to overcome the magnetic force to move the arm to some other location. This may be difficult with a fairly heavy (1 lb) object on the end of a ‚Äúwiggly arm‚Äù.

Strong lifting magnets use a 1/4 turn rotation to change the magnetic field path from purely internal to traversing the external gap. When this is done the force drops near zero.

I agree, plain magnets have good and bad points!
